revised_title: Temperature Measurements of C2 and CN Radicals in Detonation Waves
tldr: The authors conducted experiments in a shock tube to measure the electronic temperature of C2 and CN radicals during the combustion of hydrocarbon and cyanogen-oxygen mixtures. They used the brightness and emissivity technique and found abnormally high temperatures in the reaction zone. The results showed that the electronic temperature of the radicals agreed well with the calculated equilibrium temperatures.
